metadata.title: CVE-2019-10079 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Apache Traffic Server is vulnerable to HTTP/2 setting flood attacks.Earlier versions of Apache Traffic Server didn't limit the number ofsetting frames sent from the client using the HTTP/2 protocol. Users shouldupgrade to Apache Traffic Server 7.1.7, 8.0.4, or later versions.

criterions.comment: trafficserver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
